image.altText: A boy stands on a beach. His face is blurred.

props.synopsis: The parents of the 16-year-old who stabbed a Sydney bishop have spoken publicly for the first time, painting a picture of a vulnerable and violent child with serious anger management issues, longstanding mental health concerns and suspected autism spectrum disorder.

title.children: Parents of teenage terror accused detail frantic hours before attack on bishop

image.altText: A woman is seen through the windshield of a car at night. She has her hands on the wheel. A child is in the back seat.

props.synopsis: A growing crisis of school refusal is gripping Australia, leaving families in a hidden struggle with blame, shame and the fear of a lost education.

title.children: 'Confusing and shameful world': Meet the parents of the kids who refuse school

image.altText: A sign in front of a person's face that says 'I'd feel safer alone with a bear'

props.synopsis: A lot of women in my generation started believing that younger men were the great hope to ending violence against women. We waited, but little shifted and women kept dying. It's time we start accepting there will need to be an emergency response to the epidemic of male violence.

title.children: The Albanese government is in the box seat as Australians rally against gendered violence

image.altText: A composite image  showing a man in a hospital bed and a woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: After a Four Corners investigation exposed safety issues with spinal cord stimulators, more patients have come forward to share their experiences of complications from the devices or the procedures to install them.

title.children: 'I thought I was going to die': More horror stories are emerging about spinal cord stimulators

image.altText: A man in a store filled with toys and boardgames.

props.synopsis: Just when you thought global supply chains and shipping was back to normal, there are new issues leading to higher costs for importers, distributors and customers.

title.children: Retailers are struggling as shipping delays and costs make moving things more difficult

image.altText: A graphic showing a hand holding up a phone, with an incoming call from a mysterious hooded figure.

props.synopsis: The number of scams reported by Australians has hit a new record high, even though the amount lost has declined.

title.children: Scammers are becoming more sophisticated – and Australians with retirement savings are a big target

image.altText: A laptop computer sits open on a bed in a dark room showing an email account on screen.

props.synopsis: The federal government is seeking public feedback on whether the eSafety commissioner's online enforcement powers should extend to cover hate speech, 'pile-ons' and deepfakes.

title.children: Should the eSafety commissioner regulate hate speech, pile-ons and deepfakes? The government wants public feedback on the idea

image.altText: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel delivers a mass for the first time after his alleged stabbing

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel has returned to the same Wakeley church where he was stabbed and given his first sermon since the alleged terror incident.

title.children: Bishop delivers first mass since alleged stabbing at Sydney church

image.altText: Three women looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: Queensland's response to youth offending has once again been thrust into the spotlight, with an ABC investigation revealing the repeated institutional failures that helped create one of the state's youngest killers.

title.children: Experts say Queensland's youth justice crisis was 'entirely predictable'. How did we get here?

image.altText: A young women wearing a red dress sits in front of a grand piano.

props.synopsis: To celebrate the last day of Chinese New Year, Florence Le's family picked her up from the mental health facility she was staying. Two days later, the mother and piano teacher died by suicide inside Sydney's Liverpool Hospital.

title.children: 'Florence didn't want to die': Family speaks after 28yo Sydney woman dies by suicide in hospital

image.altText: Illustration of two boys running away after stabbing other boy who is on ground bleeding out.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation reveals the failings that helped create one of Queensland's youngest killers.

title.children: Cody was known to child safety since he was a baby. These are the failings that helped make him a killer

image.altText: A Bigambul and Kamilaroi artist wearing a black hoodie and beannie holds a golden lion trophy.

props.synopsis: The Toowoomba-born artist has been thrust into the global spotlight after winning a major award at this year's Venice Biennale.

title.children: You may not know this Australian artist, but he has just won the 'Oscar' of the art world

image.altText: A mango cut open ready to eat.

props.synopsis: Demand for seedless fruit is growing and the technology needed to create new varieties is improving rapidly, but some in the industry say "the price point just hasn't been there" to convince farmers to grow them.

title.children: Seedless mangoes could be around the corner, but are shoppers willing to pay for them?

image.altText: Woman and dog sit on grass and smile at camera in backyard

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory is losing thousands more residents interstate than it's gaining, meaning the jurisdiction is set to miss its 2030 population target of 300,000 people.

title.children: Paige loved living in the NT. But she's one of the thousands to leave in the past year

image.altText: Three rugby leage players, one running with ball, one holding his head in his hand, the other celebrating with fans

props.synopsis: Sydney produced an Anzac Day masterclass to thump the Dragons, Parramatta has given up another second-half lead, while Cronulla face the true tests of their premiership credentials. Here is our Round-Up from another weekend of NRL action.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Roosters make a massive statement, the Eels collapse again, Sharks' real tests start now

image.altText: A sign that says Rockingham General Hospital

props.synopsis: WA Homicide Squad detectives charge a man with murder after he allegedly assaulted the woman he lived with and set fire to their home in Perth's south.

title.children: Man charged with murder after Perth woman allegedly assaulted, left in burning house

image.altText: Children and adults holding anti-violence signs at the Perth rally.

props.synopsis: The death of 27 women this year in Australia has prompted mass protests across the country, with demonstrators calling on the government to take action.

title.children: Thousands rally in Perth and in cities and towns across the country to protest against gender-based violence

image.altText: MicrosoftTeams-image (30)

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese makes an impromptu address during a rally against gendered violence in Canberra.

title.children: Albanese tells rally gendered violence is 'a problem of our entire society'

image.altText: Harry wearing a blue shirt placing a medal around the neck of a man

props.synopsis: Prince Harry will attend a church service on May 8th to mark the anniversary of the multi-sport event for military personnel wounded in action he founded in 2017.

title.children: Prince Harry set to return to London to celebrate Invictus Games' 10th anniversary

image.altText: A golden pocket watch.

props.synopsis: A golden watch belonging to the Titanic's richest passenger and a violin bag belonging to the bandmaster have gone under the hammer in England.

title.children: Watch belonging to Titanic's richest passenger sells for record sum

image.altText: A woman performing a squat inside a gym.

props.synopsis: Research finds the knee may have a better ability to heal than previously thought, and suggests that some patients may be better off without surgery.

title.children: Can you heal an ACL tear without surgery? A new Australian study says yes, but not all surgeons are convinced

image.altText: John Cecchi preparing for a dive off the Perth coast

props.synopsis: A Perth archaeologist and anthropologist has made an unexpected discovery — some of the known shipwrecks off the WA coast aren't where they're supposed to be.

title.children: Search for known shipwrecks off WA coast finds some just aren't where they're supposed to be

image.altText: A motorbike involved in a fatal crash.

props.synopsis: A motorcyclist has died on a WA road every week on average this year with the majority of them men in their 40s and older.

title.children: Older riders considering getting on a motorbike urged to 'think about the risk'

image.altText: a rainbow flag being lowered into a fire on the floor by two people among a crowd

props.synopsis: Rights groups say it is a "serious blow to fundamental human rights" that Iraq passed new laws which sentence people who engage in same-sex relations to up to 15 years in prison.

title.children: 'Attack on human rights': Iraq criminalises same-sex relationships with threats of up to 15 years in prison

image.altText: A compsoite image of two detained Russian journalists.

props.synopsis: Two Russian journalists have been arrested and charged over accusations they worked for a group founded by late Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny.

title.children: Two Russian journalists on 'extremism' charges over alleged work for Navalny group

image.altText: A man with thinning white hair and white beard waives with his right hand

props.synopsis: As the biggest election in the world begins, academics and activists abroad have been barred from entering India after speaking out against Narendra Modi and policies of his government.

title.children: 'Classic authoritarian': Modi government denies entry to 'overseas citizens'

image.altText: An old photo of a young girl with her face blurred

props.synopsis: The fundamentalist sect is known by a variety of names including the Two by Twos, The Church With No Name, The Truth and The Way, and has about 8,000 followers across Australia.

title.children: FBI investigating secretive Christian sect with Australian followers for historical child sex abuse

image.altText: A young man looks at the camera

props.synopsis: The 21-year-old is believed to have left his vehicle on foot to seek help and was last seen near Coconut Wells, 30km north of Broome, on Friday.

title.children: Broome police search for missing man Zane Stevens after vehicle was bogged in marshland

image.altText: Rugby league coach Ricky Stuart, in a white polo shirt, looking concerned during a match

props.synopsis: Ricky Stuart's 500th NRL match as coach ends on a sour note, with the Cronulla Sharks thumping his Canberra Raiders 40-0.

title.children: Ricky's Raiders flogged 40-0 in coach's 500th NRL match as Cronulla move to top of ladder

image.altText: Isaac Heeney is congratulated after kicking a Sydney Swans AFL goal.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans thump Hawthorn by 76 points to record their sixth win of the season, following Gold Coast's victory over West Coast at Carrara.

title.children: Classy Swans win big over Hawks at MCG, Suns down the Eagles

image.altText: A NSW Waratahs Super W player crosses the goal line to score a try.

props.synopsis: Snapping a three-year premiership drought, the Waratahs dominate Fijian Drua 50-14 in the Super Rugby Women's season decider to complete an undefeated campaign.

title.children: NSW Waratahs trounce Drua to claim fifth Super Rugby Women's title

image.altText: Nicole Kidman arrives on the red carpet for the American Film Institute Lifetime Achievement Awards.  in a gold sparkly dress

props.synopsis: The Oscar winner and five-time Academy Award nominee joins previous recipients such as Meryl Streep, Julie Andrews, Al Pacino and George Clooney.

title.children: Nicole Kidman becomes first Aussie to be celebrated for lifetime achievements by AFI

image.altText: Jacinta Allan and Jacqui Wandin pictured look at a framed copy of Wiliam Barak's 1886 letter

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan is set to become the first Australian head of state to appear at an Indigenous-led truth-telling inquiry when she appears before the Yoorrook Justice Commission this week.

title.children: In the heart of Wurundjeri country, Jacinta Allan is feeling the weight of history

image.altText: a smashed window with a bullet hole after a targeted shooting

props.synopsis: The five people inside the Blacktown house were uninjured following Saturday's targeted shooting — the second incident at the same location.

title.children: Family home in Sydney's west shot at twice in two weeks in case of 'mistaken identity'

image.altText: A woman conducts a choir or brightly coloured performers, outside under a tree

props.synopsis: Scientists have been singing the praises of community choirs for decades, and they're only just scratching the surface on all of the benefits for cognitive, social and emotional wellbeing. So what is it about coming together in song that feels so magical?

title.children: The neuroscience of singing: How choirs help our brains and bodies recover from burnout
